summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T Corporation. It commands AT&T to appear in court and produce telephone usage and billing records for the account in the name of Jeffrey E. Epstein for the period January 1, 2001, through December 31, 2004, as part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) for which the subpoena is issued.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands telephone records for the account in his name from 2001-2004, indicating his communications are relevant to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued this subpoena.

connections.description: The subpoena for Epstein's phone records is issued in the criminal case against Maxwell, indicating the government is investigating their connections and communications.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for AT&T
events.description: AT&T Corporation is commanded to appear in court to testify and produce Jeffrey Epstein's telephone records from 2001-2004.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: United States Attorney Audrey Strauss issues a subpoena to AT&T for records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed AT&T for all telephone usage and billing records for Jeffrey Epstein's account from January 1, 2001, through December 31, 2004.
The subpoena was issued as part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The records were demanded for a court appearance scheduled for November 29, 2021.
Failure to comply would constitute contempt of court, subjecting AT&T to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
